query: I lost the textbook I borrowed last semester, and now I need to borrow the same title again instead of buying a new one. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Mentions loss and buy vs borrow, but final intent is to borrow again.

query: I’m thinking about getting a copy of a reference book for my report, but I don’t want to buy it if I can just borrow it on campus. Where should I go first?

meta.notes: User explicitly prefers borrowing over buying.

query: I need a brand-new notebook and some pens for class tomorrow, not something to borrow. Which place on campus should I visit?

meta.notes: Clear preference for buying new supplies.

query: I’ve already borrowed the novel I’m reading, but I liked it so much that I want to own my own copy. Where can I go on campus to buy the book?

meta.notes: Mentions borrowed book but final intent is purchase.

query: For this exam, I don’t really care about owning the textbook forever. I just need to use it for a week or two and give it back later. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Borrow/return pattern implies library even though not named.

query: I want to buy a fresh copy of the lab manual so I can write directly in it, not just borrow a copy that I have to keep clean. Where should I head?

meta.notes: Buying emphasized; cannot write in a borrowed copy.

query: I’m not sure whether I’ll really need this statistics book after this semester, so I’d rather not spend money on it if I can avoid it. Is there a place where I can just borrow it on campus?

meta.notes: Cost-sensitive, prefers borrowing over buying.

query: My friend told me I could either buy the textbook or just check it out here at school. I definitely want my own new copy to keep. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Clear intent to own a new copy.

query: I previously bought an old edition of a programming book, but now the teacher said we must use the newest edition. I want to purchase the latest version on campus. Where do I go?

meta.notes: Clear need to buy latest edition.

query: I already bought too many books this semester and I’m short on money, so I’d like to get this new title without paying if possible and return it when I’m done. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Cost complaint and desire to avoid buying → borrow.

query: For my graduation project I need a book that I’ll keep annotating and carrying around everywhere for months, so I don’t want a copy that I have to return. On campus, where should I go to get my own copy?

meta.notes: Long-term ownership and annotation → buy.

query: I’m checking where I should go if I just want to flip through a few different books on a topic for a day, without buying them or keeping them. What’s the best place on campus for that?

meta.notes: Browsing multiple books with no buying, no ownership → library.

query: I’m torn between buying the textbook and just borrowing it. If I decide to only use it temporarily this semester and then give it back, where should I actually go on campus?

meta.notes: Explicitly chooses temporary use and return.

query: この授業の教科書、新品が欲しいんだけど、誰かから借りるんじゃなくて、自分のものとして手に入れたい。キャンパス内ならどこに行けば買える？

meta.notes: Japanese; clearly wants to buy a new personal copy.

query: I already have a copy of the book at home that I bought years ago, but for this assignment I just need to borrow a campus copy for a short while instead of purchasing anything new. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Has purchased before but current intent is borrowing.

query: I was going to borrow the textbook, but I realized I want to highlight all over it and keep it after the semester ends. So now I’ve decided I actually want to buy it. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Plan change: borrow → buy; final intent is buying.

query: I’m comparing two options: either I buy all my reference books, or I just borrow what I need and return them when the report is done. If I go with the second option, which place on campus should I visit?

meta.notes: User explicitly chooses the borrowing option.

query: I don’t want a copy that other people have written in or used before; I’d feel better starting with a completely new textbook that I own. Where is that on campus?

meta.notes: Strong preference for new/owned → bookstore.

query: I’m okay with returning the textbook at the end and I really don’t want to spend any more money this month. Is there a place where I can just check it out instead of buying it?

meta.notes: Return + avoid spending → borrowing.

query: I was thinking of going to the place where you can borrow books, but actually I want to pick up a new notebook and a fresh copy of the textbook that I can keep. Which place fits that better?

meta.notes: Mentions library implicitly but final intent is buying new items.

query: I’m exhausted from group work and just want a quiet place to focus alone on reading for a few hours, not chatting or eating. Where on campus should I go?

meta.notes: Quiet, focused reading, explicitly not chatting or eating → library.

query: I want to hang out with some classmates and casually talk over snacks between lectures, not necessarily study seriously. Which place would be better for that?

meta.notes: Social, snacks, chatting → cafeteria.

query: I need to review for a big test and I really don’t want a noisy environment with people laughing and eating around me. Where can I study in peace?

meta.notes: Explicitly avoids noisy/eating environment → library.

query: I don’t feel like studying seriously right now. I just want to sit somewhere on campus, kill some time, maybe chat and look at my phone for a while. Where’s a good place?

meta.notes: Time-killing, chatting; cafeteria is more appropriate than library.

query: I want to read quietly, but being stuck inside all day is making me tired. Is there a place outdoors on campus where I can relax and read without too much noise?

meta.notes: Outdoor quiet reading → garden fits better than cafeteria.

query: I thought about going to the cafeteria, but I’m afraid I’ll just end up chatting and not studying. I really need to focus on this report. Where should I actually go instead?

meta.notes: Plan change from cafeteria to serious study → library.

query: 友達とちょっとだべりながら課題も少しだけ進めたい。図書館みたいに静かすぎるところじゃなくて、多少うるさくても大丈夫な場所に行きたい。どこがいい？

meta.notes: Wants chatting + light work, explicitly not too quiet → cafeteria.

query: I need to join an online meeting with my research supervisor and I really need a place where background noise and chatter will be minimal. Where on campus should I go?

meta.notes: Low-noise environment → library.

query: I have a gap of two hours before my next lecture and I don’t feel like doing heavy studying, just relaxing and maybe chatting a bit with friends over something to drink. Where would you send me?

meta.notes: Gap time, light chatting, drinks → cafeteria.

query: I’m completely burned out from noisy group projects and I want somewhere calm where people won’t come up and start talking to me. I just want to read in silence. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Strong preference for silence and less social interaction → library.

query: I brought my own lunch and I want a place where I can casually eat and chat a bit without worrying about being told off for talking. Where on campus is suitable?

meta.notes: Eating and chatting allowed → cafeteria.

query: I was going to head to the library, but then I realized I just want to hang out and not concentrate on anything serious. Is there a better spot for just killing time?

meta.notes: Plan change from study to hanging out → cafeteria.

query: I want to review lecture slides, but I also need somewhere that’s not super strict about silence, because I might have to whisper with my friend about the material. Which place is better?

meta.notes: Mixed study + quiet talking; cafeteria is more reasonable compromise.

query: I want to focus 100% on writing my report and I know I’ll get distracted if I see food or hear people chatting. Please send me somewhere that’s clearly meant for concentrated work.

meta.notes: Concentrated work, avoids food/chat → library.

query: I’d like to sit in a green space where I can think about my project ideas, not necessarily study strictly, but also not be surrounded by loud conversations. Any good place on campus?

meta.notes: Outdoor, reflective, relatively quiet → garden.

query: I’m feeling a bit sick but also want to stay active. I’d like to get some advice first before I decide whether it’s safe to exercise today. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Wants medical advice before exercise → clinic.

query: I’m totally fine physically and really want to work up a sweat and train my body today. Which place on campus is best for doing actual workouts?

meta.notes: Healthy and wants exercise → gym.

query: I’ve had chest pain since yesterday and I’m worried it might be serious. I’m not asking where to exercise; I want to see someone who can check my condition. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Serious symptoms, explicitly not exercise → clinic.

query: I feel a bit sluggish from sitting all day, but I don’t have any injuries or health issues. I just want a place on campus where I can move my body and exercise. Where is that?

meta.notes: No health issue, wants exercise → gym.

query: My knee has been hurting recently, and I’m not sure if I should keep training or rest. I want professional advice first, not a place to work out. Where should I visit?

meta.notes: Needs medical advice, explicitly not for workout → clinic.

query: I already talked with a doctor and they said it’s safe to start exercising again. Now I want to go to the place on campus where I can actually do the training. Where is that?

meta.notes: Consult already done; now wants exercise location → gym.

query: 最近ちょっとめまいがして不安なんだけど、無理して運動する前に誰かに相談したい。トレーニングする場所じゃなくて、体調を診てもらえるところはどこ？

meta.notes: Wants health consultation, explicitly not training → clinic.

query: I’d like to start exercising regularly to get in better shape, and I don’t feel sick or injured at all. Which campus facility should I use to do workouts?

meta.notes: Clear exercise goal, no health issues → gym.

query: I was planning to hit the gym, but this morning I suddenly developed a fever and I’m now worried something is wrong. I want someone to check my health first. Where should I go instead?

meta.notes: Plan change from gym to health check → clinic.

query: I don’t need medicine or a diagnosis; I just want a place with equipment where I can train my muscles and get stronger. Which facility is that?

meta.notes: Explicitly no diagnosis/medicine, only training → gym.

query: I want to hear from a medical professional whether it’s safe for me to keep doing sports after a recent injury, before I decide how hard I can train. Who should I visit on campus?

meta.notes: Health clearance before sports → clinic.

query: Right now I don’t want to talk about symptoms or get checked; I only want to run on a treadmill and maybe lift some weights. Which place matches that?

meta.notes: Explicitly avoids consult, purely exercise → gym.

query: I’m not sure if what I’m feeling is just fatigue or an actual health problem. Before doing any heavy exercise, I want someone to examine me. Where should I go on campus?

meta.notes: Unsure if health issue; wants exam before exercise → clinic.

query: I’m late for class and need to go to the place where the actual lecture is happening, not somewhere to self-study quietly on my own. Where should I rush to?

meta.notes: Attending scheduled lecture vs self-study → lecture_hall.

query: I don’t have any class right now but I want a place to do my own studying and read textbooks quietly. I’m not looking for a lecture or presentation. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Self-study, explicitly not a lecture → library.

query: I’m supposed to attend a talk that’s part of a course, where the professor will speak to a large group at once. Which place on campus is used for that kind of session?

meta.notes: Talk/presentation for a course → lecture_hall.

query: I just want somewhere I can sit alone and review my lecture notes without a teacher talking in front of me. Where should I head?

meta.notes: Wants no teacher, quiet review → library.

query: 授業の時間に間に合いそうだから、先生の講義が行われている場所に直接向かいたい。自習室じゃなくて、講義そのものが行われているところはどこ？

meta.notes: Explicitly lecture itself, not self-study room → lecture_hall.

query: I was going to go straight to the lecture, but I realized I’m so far behind that I’d rather quietly review the basics by myself first instead of sitting through today’s talk. Where should I go instead?

meta.notes: Plan change from lecture to self-study → library.

query: I’m not enrolled in any class right now; I just want to attend a big open talk that’s being hosted on campus in a hall. Which type of place would that be?

meta.notes: Big open talk in a hall → lecture_hall.

meta.notes: Avoids lecture, wants independent practice → library.

meta.notes: Wants to attend scheduled session → lecture_hall.

query: I thought about sitting in on the lecture, but I realized I really need to catch up by reading the textbook slowly somewhere quiet, without a teacher speaking. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Switch from lecture attendance to quiet reading → library.

query: I’m not looking for a big presentation or talk; I just want a spot to spread out my notes, maybe stay for a few hours, and review the material on my own. Where’s best for that?

meta.notes: Self-study, explicitly not big presentation → library.

query: There’s an important required lecture for my course starting soon, and I need to go to the place where the professor will be giving the talk to all the students at once. Where is that?

meta.notes: Required lecture to many students at once → lecture_hall.

query: I need help with my course registration and I don’t know which office handles that kind of administrative procedure. Where on campus should I ask?

meta.notes: Administrative procedure / registration → help_desk.

query: I’m not looking for a place to study or attend class; I just need someone who can answer questions about scholarships and official paperwork. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Administrative questions, explicitly not study/class → help_desk.

query: I want to find a book on campus and learn more about a topic in depth by myself, not ask about forms or procedures. Where should I go?

meta.notes: General learning/book search → library, contrasted with admin help.

query: I want to look up background materials and read about the theory behind my course, rather than asking about procedures or forms. Which place should I choose?

query: I was going to head straight to the help counter, but I realized what I actually need right now is a place to read and collect sources for my essay, not ask about procedures. Where should I go instead?

query: I’d like to be around people and chat casually, maybe make some new friends, rather than being completely alone and silent. Where on campus is good for that?

meta.notes: Wants social, chatting → cafeteria more suitable than library/garden.

query: I’m preparing for an exam and need a silent place with lots of textbooks I can use without having to purchase all of them. Where is the best spot?

meta.notes: Silent space with many textbooks to use; library.

query: I want to read outside in the sunshine but also be close enough to grab a proper meal when I get hungry. Which place should I pick as my base?

meta.notes: Balance between relaxing and access to food; cafeteria prioritized.

query: I’m starving and really need a full meal, not just a bench to sit on, even though I’d like it to be a bit relaxing if possible. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Food requirement dominates; cafeteria vs garden.

query: I already ate, so I don’t need food. I just want a calm, green place to sit and unwind for a while between classes. Where is good?

meta.notes: No food need; wants green relaxing spot; garden.

query: I’m not really hungry, but I’d like a place where my friends can talk casually without disturbing people who are studying. Where should we meet?

meta.notes: Social chatting; cafeteria vs garden/library.

query: I want to eat lunch quickly and then have a short walk in a peaceful area nearby, but I care more about getting food first. Where do I start?

meta.notes: Priority on food; cafeteria.

query: I don’t want a noisy dining hall right now, I just want to sit somewhere green and quiet, maybe with a snack I already brought. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Rejects dining hall; wants quiet green spot; garden.

query: I’d like to have lunch with a friend in a place where we can talk normally and not worry too much about disturbing others, even if it’s not the most peaceful. Suggestions?

meta.notes: Social lunch; cafeteria vs garden.

query: I’m not planning to eat, but I’d love a spot with trees and benches where I can just clear my head for a while. Where should I head?

meta.notes: No food; seeking nature and benches; garden.

query: I want to quickly grab a decent hot meal on campus; I don’t care if it’s a bit noisy or crowded as long as it’s convenient. Where’s best?

meta.notes: Emphasis on hot meal; cafeteria.

query: Rather than sitting inside with lots of people eating, I’d like a relaxing outdoor space where I can just drink some water and think. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Rejects indoor eating space; wants relaxing outdoor; garden.

query: My legs feel heavy and I’m short of breath after climbing the stairs. I’m not trying to get fit; I’m worried something might be wrong. Who should I see on campus?

meta.notes: Health concern; clinic vs gym.

query: I’m not sick or injured, I just want to start a regular workout routine and use proper equipment. Where should I go?

meta.notes: No illness; wants workout equipment; gym.

query: I’ve been feeling dizzy and getting headaches lately, and I want a professional to check whether it’s serious rather than just exercising more. Where on campus?

meta.notes: Needs checkup; clinic.

query: I want to build muscle and get stronger using weights and machines, not talk to a doctor. Where should I head?

meta.notes: Opposes doctor; wants training; gym.

query: I twisted my ankle in PE class and it hurts to walk. I’m not looking for a workout; I need someone to check the injury. Where do I go?

query: I keep gaining weight and I want a place where I can consistently exercise and sweat, more than just getting advice. What facility should I use?

meta.notes: Wants facility to exercise; gym.

query: I’m not sure whether my back pain is just from bad posture or something more serious, so I want a medical opinion first, not just stretching instructions. Where should I go?

meta.notes: Needs diagnosis; clinic prioritized over gym.

query: I already got a health check recently and I’m fine; now I want a place to do regular cardio and weight training. Which campus facility is right?

meta.notes: Health checked; now wants training; gym.

query: I just fainted this morning and my hands are shaking. I don’t think just running on a treadmill will fix this… Who should I see?

query: I’m not injured or sick at all; I simply want a place to play sports and get stronger with other students. Where should I go on campus?
